cab.content: Hi4LL GNsplftary Secret.90:From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,-14th May 1919.(Received loth.)6r)38. 14th May. Part 1. Dakka still reported evacuated as result of our air raids, and do movements of importance observed on Jalalabad Dakka road. Reports from several sources give strength of. troops marching Kabul to Kandahar as 6,000 infantry and some guns. Population of Argandab said to be arming and collecting supplies. No tribal lashkars had collected in Tirah, Mohmand and Bajavir up to 10th May and nothing further from Khost.* Part 2. 12th May. No change in situation at Landi Kotal. All quiet Kohat, Waziristan and Baluchistan. Operations on 11th May included air reconnaissance in Bazar to Besawal and Kam Dakka. Bombing raids were carried out with effect. Weather conditions bad for air work. Guns captured by us on 11th now number six and one Gardiner gun. Estimate enemy killed on 11th at least 100, including many Afghan regulars,
